summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons policy manual section detailing the elements of prohibited acts for inmates, categorizing offenses by severity level (Greatest, High, Moderate, Low Moderate) and providing definitions for each offense code. It outlines the required elements to prove a violation: subject, time, location, act, and victim where applicable. The document appears to be standard prison regulations, not directly related to Epstein case events or individuals.
keyFacts: Document is a Bureau of Prisons policy manual effective November 18, 2020 outlining prohibited acts for inmates.
Defines four categories of offense severity: Greatest, High, Moderate, and Low Moderate.

Lists specific offense codes with detailed elements required for proof, including codes for killing (100), assault (101, 224), escape (102, 200), sexual assault (114, 229), and drug-related offenses (111-113).
Specifies that elements must include subject identification, time, location, act description, and victim where applicable.
No specific individuals, events, or locations related to the Epstein case are mentioned in this document.
